Articles.Content:
The water is quite dense, yes

Ohhh, not hoping for this or anything but a few easter eggs at the deepest darkest parts of Laythe would be awesome, like a sunken temple.

Ohhh, not hoping for this or anything but a few easter eggs at the deepest darkest parts of Laythe would be awesome, like a sunken temple.

-The remains of the Space Kraken perhaps.. Or its operating base that uses floating point glitchines to destroy our crafts.. Muhahahaha

-The remains of the Space Kraken perhaps.. Or its operating base that uses floating point glitchines to destroy our crafts.. Muhahahaha

You mean something like a Bermuda Triangle? Or somethign like that tower which destroyed vehicles in Just Cause 2 (if someone played that game )

On a slightly unrelated note, nobody seems to realize how underpowered the 2m parts are, the tanks are fine but the engines are far too heavy for their thrust, I just use 1m parts for my Interplanetary craft, 2m engines should really be lightened in 0.17.

I think this is mainly because the 2m Engines are meant either for A)taking off from Kerbin or landing somewhere.

I myself use three 1m engines as a second stage and then a single 1m for third stage. I really think getting to these new planets (and their moons) are going to be AWESOME! Can't wait.

Those adapters sound awesome, do they contain fuel?

I hope so, otherwise they would be completely useless.

As I do not encourage big submarines that we would use on Kerbin, but little un-manned deep sea probes to deploy on moons/planets such as Laythe, or you could also use them for diving into the depths of Jool and the other gas giants.

Also if we ever get a mini-VAB for deisgning rovers you would also design your D.S.P. (Deep Sea Probe) or G.D.P. (Gas-giant Discovery Probe) in there too.

Edited September 5, 2012 by swiftgates24
Grammar (School has done it again)

I still think the answer to Laythe is to add pontoons or water skis to spaceplanes. Not sure if there's a mod for this yet, but the situation seems to demand it if we ever want to get home again, barring a very, very precise island landing.
Crewed and robotic submersibles would be great for exploring Laythe. Jool, not so much.

I just received a patcher update notification....

(Verified with pristine .16 standby copy)
New patcher is out.

New patcher is out.

I'm trying not to get excited yet.
Where do you see that?

I still think the answer to Laythe is to add pontoons or water skis to spaceplanes. Not sure if there's a mod for this yet, but the situation seems to demand it if we ever want to get home again, barring a very, very precise island landing.

You could also use those structural fuel tanks, they're light, and should do the job. You could also attach radial decouplers to them so after take off you can get rid of some weight...

P.S. Thanks for the Happy Birthday e-mail KSP Forums

Edited September 5, 2012 by Panichio

You could also use those structural fuel tanks

There is a mod for water and snow pontoon/skis, also nova said he would be adding more land.

There is a mod for water and snow pontoon/skis, also nova said he would be adding more land.

I've seen the mod, and yeah, I heard about him adding more land, but still, for the people who simply don't want mods.

I hope so, otherwise they would be completely useless.

Nope, they're structral. (At least I think they are).

I just received a patcher update notification....

(Verified with pristine .16 standby copy)

Then the patcher got an update, not the game.

I think he took that picture, and is this for Mac as well?

Wow, this thread has 100 pages already. Time for a new one soon.

Wow, this thread has 100 pages already. Time for a new one soon.

No, it's not.

I think he took that picture, and is this for Mac as well?

Wow, this thread has 100 pages already. Time for a new one soon.

The new forum software can handle more than 1000 posts. No need for a new thread.
Reminds me of the Y2K bug

I'm not sure if this has been answered yet, but I was curious if .17 would introduce parts that allow for crew beside the standard command modules? I'm looking forward to being able to transport more than 3 Kerbalnauts at once.

New patcher is out.

Were can you get it?

I've noticed that the devs have been rather quiet this cycle. Is there any reason for this? The .16 hit a good while ago and besides a few posts about the kraken I feel like we have received nothing much in what is to be in store for the next update. It also seems like the mod makers have all but quit. Maybe I'm not as good at navigating this new forum though. I guess I'm just a little perturbed by the lack of involvement the community seems to have.

The devs being quiet is partly caused by the change of forums, as they were waiting for blogs to work properly, and also due to the amount of work they are putting in the next update. Sure, we haven't had much info since, but you can get an idea by looking at the features list for 0.17.

Regarding modders, well, maybe they're waiting for the new version, maybe they don't have much more to add to theirs mods, maybe they don't know what to create...
